page.title: 16INDUSTRY
page.content: Stamford played little part in the industrial expansion of the Victorian age. There were however, some factories, among them an agricultural equipment manufacturers,electrical equipment and industrial equipment factories, but these were sited away from the centre of the town, so their presence (and employment) did not detract from the beauty of the town. Much industry was sited along the railway to Essendine (linking with GNR). The main reason for the lack of industry in the town was the fact that the Great Northern Railway did not pass through the town, instead going through nearby Peterborough, which is now a major industrial and population centre. One major employer in Stamford today is Mirrlees Blackstones, engine manufacturers, who employ around 700 people.
